alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 11:56AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Laurel, Owsley, southeastern Jackson and northwestern Clay Counties through 1230 PM EST... At 1156 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Peoples to Maplesville to London-Corbin Airport. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Langnau, Cornelius, Bond, Crawford, Deese, Dabolt, Annville, Green Hill, Moores Creek and Parrot around 1200 PM EST. Mildred, Fogertown, Settle Store, Benge, Deer Lick, Olin, Tyner, Welchburg, Atkinstown and Gray Hawk around 1205 PM EST. Mummie, Portersburg, Herd, Byron, Privett, Maulden, Zekes Point, Malcomb, Nathanton and Shepherdtown around 1210 PM EST. Sacker Gap, Green Hall, Sturgeon, Grace, Chestnutburg, Burning Springs, Sidell, Elian, Sextons Creek and Urban around 1215 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Manchester, Treadway, Felty, Thomas, Endee, Fall Rock, Scoville, Laurel Creek, Vincent, Travellers Rest, Booneville, Trixie, Turin, Ammie, Chestnut Gap, Levi, Taff, Eversole, Wild Cat, Hensley, Teges, Newfound, Sebastian, Stay, Oneida, Grass, Gobbard, Ricetown and Seth. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 36 and 40. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County near mile marker 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
